importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The outage occurred on Monday, October 20, 2025, at approximately 07:11 GMT, marking the beginning of a major disruption affecting global digital services.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The AWS outage lasted from 07:11 to 10:11 GMT, during which 113 services failed and users experienced widespread disruption across financial, social, gaming, and media platforms.

keyTakeAways: A technical update to DynamoDB’s API in AWS’s Virginia data center triggered a DNS error, preventing apps from finding server addresses.
The failure cascaded through 113 AWS services, including major platforms like Snapchat, Pinterest, WhatsApp, Roblox, and banks such as Venmo.
The root cause was not a cyberattack or external threat but a human error during a routine update that disrupted the Domain Name System (DNS).
AWS acknowledged the issue, deployed multiple recovery paths, and restored full operations by 10:11 GMT.
The incident underscores the critical dependence of modern digital life—finance, communication, entertainment, smart devices—on cloud infrastructure like AWS.
Despite widespread disruption, AWS's market dominance and deep integration with global services meant users did not abruptly switch providers.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A major outage at Amazon Web Services (AWS) on October 20, 2025, caused widespread disruption to digital services worldwide. The incident originated from a technical update to DynamoDB’s API in AWS’s Virginia data center, which triggered a DNS error and prevented apps from connecting to servers. This cascaded into failures of 113 AWS services, affecting major platforms including Snapchat, WhatsApp, Roblox, banks, airlines, and smart home devices. The root cause was identified as human error, not a cyberattack. While services were restored by 10:11 GMT, users faced delays and ongoing issues, underscoring how deeply modern digital life depends on cloud infrastructure. Experts noted that despite the scale of disruption, AWS's market dominance and user integration meant no significant shift in provider usage occurred.
title: What caused Amazon’s AWS outage, and why did so many major apps go offline?
